_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Coburg Dairy, LLC, located at 5001 LaCross Road in North Charleston, South Carolina, owns and operates a processing, packaging and storage facility for fluid milk products.  Ammonia is used as a refrigerant for the facility.

The facility's overall approach and commitment to chemical safety is demonstrated by:

1)The facility's commitment to the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Program, and

2)The hazard assessment, prevention program, and emergency response procedures implemented in response to the initial RMP requirements.

The management structure and oversight to ensure safety at the facility is documented in the facility's RMP and includes complaince with the applicable regulations, codes and standards.

Five Year Accident History
The facility has had no RMP reportable accidents/releases within the previous five years.

Prevention Program
The facility has implemented a Program Level 3 Prevention Program for ammonia, as required by RMP and PSM regulation. These prevention program provisions are specifically intended to minimize the probability and / or consequences of any accidental releases.  Prevention items include:  process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training, mechanical integrity, preventive maintenance, contractor training, pre-start-up reviews, management of change, etc.  The facility's prevention program is an ongoing system based on periodic training, procedure review and revision, and internal audits.

Emergency Response Program
The facility has a coordinated response with the North Charleston HAZMAT Response Team to ensure prompt response to large ammonia releases.

Summary
The facility is committed to ensuring its operations are safe and operated in accordance with all RMP/PSM requirements.  Senior management is involved in the implementation of these programs and is responsible for RMP development, implementation, and compliance.  Management is committed to the safe operation of the ammonia s

ystem through strict adherence to the applicable codes, standards, and regulations.  Updates and revisions to the RMP/PSM program are completed as necessary to ensure ongoing compliance and a safe workplace.
